DataElement.preferredName: Measured Less Than or Equal 1.5 Times Upper Limit of Normal Prothrombin Time Within Anticoagulant Agent Therapeutic Range Occurrence Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether the result of the Prothrombin Time (PT) is less than or equal to 1.5 times the institution upper limit of normal (ULN), unless the use of anticoagulant therapy requires a therapeutic range that must be observed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Measured Less Than or Equal 1.5 Times Upper Limit of Normal Prothrombin Time Within Anticoagulant Agent Therapeutic Range Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having been determined by measurement._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1.5_The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter._A measurement of the clotting time of plasma recalcified in the presence of excess tissue thromboplastin; it is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation._On the inside; contained in._Agents that prevent blood clotting. Naturally occurring agents in the blood are included only when they are used as drugs._Relating to or involved in therapy._The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Measured Less Than or Equal To Integer::1.5 Upper Limit of Normal Prothrombin Time
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having been determined by measurement.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1.5:The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:A measurement of the clotting time of plasma recalcified in the presence of excess tissue thromboplastin; it is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. It is used to determine the clotting tendency of blood, in the measure of warfarin dosage, liver damage and vitamin K status. Factors measured are fibrinogen, prothrombin, and factors V, VII, and X.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.

A measurement of the clotting time of plasma recalcified in the presence of excess tissue thromboplastin; it is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. It is used to determine the clotting tendency of blood, in the measure of warfarin dosage, liver damage and vitamin K status. Factors measured are fibrinogen, prothrombin, and factors V, VII, and X.

Property.preferredName: Within Anticoagulant Agent Therapeutic Range Occurrence
Property.preferredDefinition: On the inside; contained in.:Agents that prevent blood clotting. Naturally occurring agents in the blood are included only when they are used as drugs.:Relating to or involved in therapy.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: Any agent capable of preventing blood clot formation.
Relating to or involved in therapy.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 4/18/16 Released, used in CITN-10 and CITN-09. jk

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Prothrombin Time (PT) <=1.5 x
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prothrombin Time (PT) <=1.5 x institutional ULN unless patient is receiving anticoagulant therapy in which case the INR must be within the therapeutic range of intended use for the anticoagulant

DataElement.changeDescription: 4/15/16 Released, used in CITN-10 and CITN-09. jk
